body_content.explanation: intended to prevent AIDS from spreading (= a serious disease that destroys the body's ability to fight infection):
examples: Anti-Aids advertisements went out on TV.
As Minister of Health she oversaw a successful anti-Aids policy.

body_content.explanation: Anti-AIDS drugs limit the effects of HIV (= the virus that causes AIDS, a serious disease that destroys the body's ability to fight infection):
examples: HIV patients take a cocktail of anti-AIDS drugs.
